etymologies: Middle English, from Old French seint, from Latin sanctus ‘holy’, past participle of sancire ‘consecrate’

definitions: a person acknowledged as holy or virtuous and typically regarded as being in heaven after death

examples.text: a place dedicated to a seventh-century saint

shortDefinitions: person acknowledged as holy or virtuous

definitions: (in the Catholic and Orthodox Churches) a person formally recognized or canonized by the Church after death, who may be the object of veneration and prayers for intercession

examples.text: Innocent III stressed that only the Pope had the authority to declare a saint

shortDefinitions: person of exalted virtue who is canonized by Church after death

definitions: used in titles of religious saints
shortDefinitions: used in titles of religious saints

definitions: a member or follower of the Latter-day Saints movement; a Mormon

examples.text: Smith began to cast around for uninhabited territories where the Saints might build their Kingdom

definitions: (in or alluding to biblical use) a Christian believer

examples.text: the poor saints which are at Jerusalem

definitions: a very virtuous, kind, or patient person

examples.text: she's a saint to go on living with that man

shortDefinitions: very virtuous, kind, or patient person

definitions: formally recognize as a saint; canonize

examples.text: the sandy shores of the River Nid, where Holy Olaf's bones were laid to rest before he had been sainted
